messages.content: I have a git lfs repository now but I skipped downloading large files when cloning it. (I used GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1). Now I would like to pull one of the large files to my working tree. What command should I use?
You can use the "git lfs pull" command to pull the large file to your working tree. For example: "git lfs pull large_file.ext".

With this command, git lfs is pulling all large files in the current dir, which is not I want. This command does not receive path arguments in this way. Is there any argument that allows me to donwload a single file?

Yes, you can use the "git lfs pull" command with a specific file path. For example: "git lfs pull large_file.ext". This will pull a specific file from the remote repository to your local working tree.
